poem.title: Recycling
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
The gong farmer deals with intestinal flora.
He does honk and hum but can't cultivate timps.
When he takes a bath, you don't take it back:
It's gone from the flagstones and firedogs
Down to the glaur by the five-bar gate.
Pig-iron groin, pig-iron gruntle.
